review_body: The location is very convenient, just only 5 minutes from the nearest station and 2 stops from Shinjuku. The cafe on the first floor is also available for 24 hours which you can enjoy many international manu!

If you're looking for that final push to book this place. This is it!As a solo female traveller, I'm not the biggest fan of sharing rooms because I don't like the pressure of always being mindful of my stuff spread out in the room--for that, I always opt for getting my own room. This hotel has the best rates for solo traveling that I saw for Tokyo. So let's talk about things I love about this place.1. CostThis place is affordable, of the many locations I checked, this is one of the most affordable ones.2. LocationThe location is quiet and not on the main road which is great because it's perfect for your shut-eye. But it still remains very accessible to train stations, it's 3 minutes away from Hatagaya Station which is just two stations away from Shinjuku which means cheap train fares despite not being covered by the subway pass. It is also just 15 minutes away from the train station that is covered by the subway pass.3. Access to Food and Stores NearbyThe vicinity is also with a lot of convenience stores, hole-in-the-walls, drugstores, and restaurants. But, you need not worry about that because the hotel itself has a 24-hour cafe that is reasonably-priced.4. RoomsThe rooms are great. They're not the most spacious but I think that's the norm in Tokyo. The entrance might seem underwhelming if you're tall, but the ceilings are higher inside, I promise. :)The room is equipped with all the basic necessities you'll need, but the hotel offers more free rental equipment for other things you might need. I find that smart and considerate! Plus, I got my own room which is all that I really look for. That's a plus, yes, given most accommodations I found in the same price range has shared bathrooms.I wanna address a review I read that the toilet stinks, it's not true for me. If you smell something, just close the toilet lid and you should be good. They also offer deodorizers and humidifiers for free, if you ever encounter it.I went in the summer and their air-conditioning is perfect!5. BreakfastThe free breakfast is bread, juice, coffee, tea, and soup. Though it's the same everyday variation comes in the jams, juice flavor, and soup. But the highlight of this is the duration, they start early and end really late which is perfect if you need to leave early or just want to sleep longer and wake up late.6. WiFi and Other AmenitiesWiFi is great! It's reliable in all locations. Our Muslim friends are also considered as there is a prayer room available. :)7. StaffThis, I think is the gem of the place. For Non-Japanese, they speak and understand English! Great customer service in Japan is common, but Sakura Hotel Hatagay takes it to the next level. First off, thank you to the staff for the little things:a. Letting me get cold water in my water bottle from the bar every morning and every nightb. Helping me with my questions about getting around and how to use my subway passes together with the IC Cardsc. Giving me band-aids; this seems like a little think but I bruised myself and just needed one band-aid, buying a whole box in the drugstore seemed wasteful as I only needed one but the staff (maybe Hako, the one in your Instagram account photos) gave me two. I appreciate that very much!Most especially, I stumbled upon an issue in Tokyo and they went above and beyond to help me. Short of it is, I got left behind by my overnight bus to Osaka due to misinformation from the person who booked me. I was so tired that night, feeling lost and overwhelmed somewhere in Tokyo Station. I called the hotel and everything started to just be too much for me and started crying on the phone whilst talking to the Assistant Manager of the Hotel. I was asking them for help to contact the bus company and they were more than happy to do it for me. Filled with anxiety on the phone, they have calmed me down and offered to go back to the hotel and sort the entire thing out. They even went ahead and offered me a discounted room for the night. But since I planned to leave in the morning, they offered for me to just stay in the cafe since it's open for 24 hours. When I got to the hotel, they could not be any more accommodating and friendly towards my stressed self. They helped me just settle in the cafe with my laptop and even as far as booking a new ticket to Osaka, helping me find the cheapest rates online. That was so stressful for me as someone traveling alone, but their help made it all okay for me. I contemplated leaving the next night but they also gave me tips that there is a typhoon coming and leaving soon is a wiser decision. True enough, when I got to Osaka, a typhoon hit Tokyo which would have stranded me in Tokyo even further.To Sakura Hotel Hatagaya, thank you to the Assistant Manager who helped me and his staff on the night of September 7, 2019. I got your business cards but have not had the chance to unpack to look for them (I apologize), but I wanted to express my utmost gratitude towards your team in Hatagaya! You made my Japan experience memorable and I cannot wait to come back.

The hotel is cozy. Stuffs are very friendly. Place is close to train station and many convenient stores. The hotel food was different from what you find in local Japanese restaurant. Hotel stay comes with breakfast depending on your bookings. The breakfast starts at 4 am which is very early. For those who are to travel early can have breakfast before the journey. One of the stuff can speak multiple languages which was impressive.

It's a very nice hotel, with a perfect location for reaching Tokyo center. Shops are also close so you can buy groceries easily. Metro station is 2 minutes walk, Shinjuku only 2 stops. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. And the hotel restaurant can make it easy to eat something before your daily rout to the city. Definitely recommended!

Room was clean. Very comfy ambience. Hotel staff are all friendly and accommodating. We get the value of our money in this hotel. Will definitely stay here again next time I visit Tokyo. Will recommend this to friends.

We really enjoyed our 4-nights stay at Sakura Hatagaya. The hotel is clean and cozy. The staff is very kind and always ready to help. The location is perfect: in two minutes you can reach the metro station, visit one of the best sento we have been and have dinner in one of the traditional restaurants in the neighborhood. We definitely recommend it.

I enjoyed my stay in Sakura Hotel Hatagaya because it is near the Hatagaya station, two stations away from Shinjuku Station. It is affordable compare to other hotels in Tokyo. The room and toilet is narrow, and difficult to move for big people. The staffs are friendly and approachable. I will recommend to my friends and family.

Room was clean. Staff were helpful and spoke english. Breakfast could be improved as they served only bread everyday. Location was very good as it was located in a quiet neighbourhood but yet very near to shops and eateries and only 2 stops away from Shinjuku station.

We booked a double room, it was clean and tidy but a bit too small to cater two luggage. Sound proof was weak as we could hear laughter all night from the next door.But staff services and breakfast were very nice, location was quite convenient, drug store and convenience store were nearby and surrounded by many restaurants, which could better our stay!

Room was very small (which is expected of Tokyo) but was not an issue because we were too busy sight seeing. Everything is very clean. The hotel is less than a block away from a subway station and is right next to restaurants and drug stores. The staff is very friendly and courteous. They also speak English which is helpful. Our stay included a daily “breakfast special” which was a vegetable stew of sorts (ratatouille?), a small salad, bread, soup, and scrambled eggs, as well as coffee/tea/juice. All very good.

Great hospitality, service and facilities. Room abit small but you get what you pay for and honestly its really worth the stay. Very homely and 2 stops away from shinjuku station. Wouldnt mind going back again.

Overall affordable pricing, near to train station and shops. Halal cafe which is indeed a saviour. Comfortable room. But 1 thing is when cleaning up room, the queen bed is usually left undone and the trash not cleared.

Overall staff are very accommodating, friendly and knowledgeable. Hotel location 3 to 5 mins away from train station, Family Mart and nearby establishments, I will definitely recommend this to all travelers who would like to explore Tokyo Japan.

Stayed here for 4 nights with my boyfriend in October 2019 on a trip to Japan. The hotel is in a great location and the staff are lovely. The rooms are basic and there was a slight smell from the bathroom but other than that the hotel room was clean. Great cafe downstairs open 24/7.

Room was clean and decent size for Tokyo although the bathroom was very small and had a smell. Staff were very helpful and most welcoming. The location was convenient with local stores around and a connection on the underground.

The room was super tiny and not that clean, everything felt cheap, the bed was hard, the wifi was bad. No japanese toilet in the room, no kettle, no place for luggage, no amenities. The breakfast included bread mainly. The walls of the room were paper thin. Its location is not really ideal, there's nothing around to do. In conclusion, this place is way overpriced, I would have expected to pay half of what I did for such a bad experience. We changed to another hotel the moment we could.

This is the 3rd time I have used Sakura hotel Hatagaya for a trip with a small Scottish Judo club. this time we had a group of 11. communication from booking to arrival was brilliant. We were made to feel very welcome on arrival and the staff were all really happy and fun with great English. they made our children feel safe and welcome and were only too happy to help with any enquiries or requests. Cleaning staff were brilliant and efficient and the rooms were functional, clean and quiet.We will be using this hotel again next time we visit in a years time and would not look past it for future tours. Thank you everyone for an amazing trip which you helped make easy for us.

This is my third time staying in this hotel because of the very accessible location and availability of Halal food. They now have a new halal chicken ramen which is nice but sells out quick. My only negative experience was some of the tv channels didn't have a smooth transmission and keeps getting cut. I'm not sure if it is the tv as I was able to view all the channels smoothly in the rooms I was in previously.It was the first time I'm staying this hotel during a typhoon and I'm impressed that it was able to withstand Typhoon Hagibis with electricity and water still available after it passed. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and will come back again whenever I visit Tokyo.

Sakura hotel is nice and clean. It has a good location in cozy neighborhoods. The staff is helpful and professional. The rooms are very small, but work. A simple breakfast is included. The hotel serves food and has a furnished courtyard adjacent to the entrance.

This is my second time to stay in this hotel because of easy of accessibility to hotel location and the price is competitive with good service. The hotel staff is also very friendly. I surely stay in this hotel in the next chance.

Love this hotel, the staff is really friendly and helpful. the location is perfect, 1 minute away from the train station. the room is a little bit small but everything inside the room was excellent. thank you Sakura Hotel, i will surely comeback.

Located 2 stations away from the centre Shinjuku. Nearby convenience stores and supermarket and 7-11. Friendly staffs and knowledgeable. Provide free coffee and bread for breakfast (4:30-11am). Room is small, maximum 2 people can fit in. Bed is comfy(firm).

We started this trip by this hotel very close to the metro. Small Japanese room with sufficient comfort but watch out for large suitcases! Simple breakfast. Possibility to eat also on site. Friendly welcome. If you want to be disoriented, this is an address to have.

To start of, Sakura Hatagaya located just a minute from the subway station. Having near the station made traveling throughout Tokyo very easy. There are many eateries and convenient stores nearby. Surprisingly their cafe that open 24 hours served tasty foods with reasonable prices. However, their triple room that we booked really need to be refurbished. And they have the smallest lift with a pink carpet pasted on the wall of the lift. Perhaps they were looking for the fastest and cheapest option to modernize the lift.Not all of the staffs were friendly and it was a surprise to us. It really depend on who you meet. If you really need a hotel that near to a station with many eateries around, this is the place to consider but nothing else. With their price range and limited amenities, room that need refurbished, there are some place better.

Good hotel at a good location near Shinjuku station, helpful staff and a lovely "smaller" neighborhood. Me second time here, and for the price and location I really recommend it. Regular double room was a little small for 2 tall europeans with luggage for 2 weeks, corner double is much better.

Not fancy, but great staff, great location, and despite being a tad small it's really quite cozy and nice. We loved it, and I came back and stayed again and had just as nice an experience. Cafe has some nice vegetarian and halal options.

Price (60% discount through agoda) & location were great, staff were friendly & had good English skills. Free breakfast of bread & coffee were appreciable. I liked that there was a baggage storage area behind the front desk for people who arrived early, check in & check out were quick and painless. Overall I'd recommend this place.

Stayed here as a solo traveler, very convenient to train; friendly and helpful staff, more than met my needs for my stay in Tokyo. A breakfast is included, convenient store almost at the door of the hotel. Pleased with my choice to stay here during my visit.

Just what I wanted but nothing special. I was looking for an hotel from which I could easily walk to shinjuku and the yoyogi Park but which is not in the busy area directly. By train it was just 4 minutes but most of the time I just walked and explored the neighborhood on my way. A lot of small shrines in the area that were really stunning. Room was ok, but a little old. Especially the mattress. In some areas you could feel the springs. Bathroom could be cleaned more throughout but all in all I would recommended the hotel. Probably will go there again

Stayed 2 nights in here and I chose this hotel since it is just ONE station away from 新国立劇場 where I planned to watch a stage show there. The single room is small but with affordable price and free breakfast (toast, coffee, tea and hot soup) included, I think it is a satisfied choice for a short trip.

Small room but great value to be close to Shinjuku, the breakfast is available from 4:30 if you like to travel early and don't get into rush hour. Very friendly staff. Nice neighborhood, a lot of combini and restaurants around. There is a coin laundry at fifth floor with detergent for an extra price.

This is a gteat place to stay in Shinjuku, 24 hour reception, luggage storage, small but clean room with onsuite bathroom and breakfast was served in the morning (toast, jam, butter, peanutbutter, coffee, tea, soup). There is a station nearby, Hatagaya (but this not a metro or toei so you cannot use it with your 24 hours metro pass). Still, you can use it to get very nearby to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helful with answering questions. It might be even better if you stay a bit longer, they have a little patio outside (we arrived well after midnight and had to check out at 10, though they serve breakfast until 11, so that's a bonus).

The hotel staff was very helpful and can communicate in English. The room was very nice and clean. Hotel guests can order food from the hotel cafe at any time of the day or night. The beds are comfortable.

the comfort and clean hotel, near by station, cafe/resto, mart. i love being here, this is our first time in Japan and this hotel makes us feel home. their staff so friendly especially a man named Hoka, a handsome-helpfull staff, he also can speak Bahasa Indonesia fluently.

The hotel location is very friendly, you can walk 3 minutes to the Hatagaya metro station or 35 minutes to Shibuya station. Good restaurants around the corner, as well as a convenience store. Very nice staff!!

The place was a good location. Only 2 stops from Shinjuku station. Only thing is it’s not on the JR line do you have to pay for a seperate ticket each time you need to get to Shinjuku. The cleaners did a great job with the rooms. The rooms are tiny and not enough for a couple with luggage. The fridge is on but does not work. If you need amenities like an iron you call reception and they tell you to go collect it from downstairs. Overall, I would not stay in this place again.

If you're skeptical about staying here, don't be. This hotel is adorable and everyone who works here is extremely helpful and kind, and their English was very good. Our room was very small, but that's what we were looking for: a very affordable place we could sleep in after going out all day! The room had everything we needed. They offer a complimentary light breakfast each morning and the soup was great. Go ahead and book!

Good community hostel feel in hotel setup. We had a room for 4 adults - 2 parents and a 15 & 18 year old. Easy. Location was both cool and central as well. Staff were welcoming and chatty; breakfast was a great starter with some basic freebies, and more available to purchase.

Great place, friendly staff. Quaint rooms (tidied daily) ensuite and simple breakfast provided each day. Good value for money, 3 minutes from Hatagaya train station close to key places to visit and hassle-free. Umbrellas provided too! Will definitely stay here again if we visit Tokyo. Thank you, Sakura staff.

This was my first trip to Japan. The room was quite small, but we only needed it as a place to sleep after exploring Tokyo most of the day. The staff were really attentive, kind, and spoke English pretty well. The hotel location avoids the busy-ness of downtown Tokyo, but is really close to train station entrances and convenient stores. I'd say the location was a real winner.

The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was small and a bit old and tired, the location was reasonable. Over all it’s ok if you don’t expect too much. I’m not sure that I would stay there again, but I haven’t ruled it out completely.

I really loved staying here! Right beside Hatagaya station which was extremely helpful. Although the neighbourhood is quiet there are many stores that stay open 24/7. The room was small(I think that’s to be expected in Tokyo) but very clean! The hotel is older but it’s been kept very well. My friend fell ill during our stay and the hotel clerk called a hospital, made sure they could take us and then gave us a map to help us. The rest of the staff was very kind too, always smiling. If I visit Tokyo again I will be staying here.

A Nice hotel near train station. Also have convenient stores and supermarket nearby. Room is ok with private bathroom which I prefer. Staff in this hotel are very accommodating and friendly. Will be back here for sure.

It would be every better if there is an option including breakfast and breakfast with some more option. Though the simple toast and coffee breakfast is kind of nice, some salad will add more value. Soup was included and that was good.

When we arrived, it was around 11 AM, the male staff who has a good command of English described that check-in was 3 PM onwards, so he offered the luggage storage area for us to put our luggages. So we settled the billing first before proceeding to the cafe, which is just to the left of the reception.The cafe was cosy with subtle music played in the background. The people: some were chilling, some were on their laptops, some were with their group, laughing and sharing stories. Since we are Muslims, we are delighted that the cafe offered Muslim-friendly menu, properly labelled on the display. Food arrived within a 10 minutes (or less) wait.Near the toilet, a prayer room is provided- which is really convenient since the room is too small for a space to pray.After 3 PM, we checked in. The interior of the lift was too red and has a claustrophobic feel for my liking, since they used a carpeted red wall (the only part of the building that irked me).The room we stayed was one double bed, for 2 people. When we opened the door, it was only enough for the entry of one person at a time, immediate left is a mirror and a place to hang our clothes, and to the right is the toilet. You have the double bed near to the table and TV. Small space for walking but it does its job when your focus is travelling and only require the room to sleep in.Amenities like, hair dryer, slippers, towels, toothbrush and toothpaste, cups were provided. There is free shaver and shaving gel that can be taken near the receptionist.The hotel is conveniently located near the Hatagaya train station (within a 5 minutes walk), which you take a 130 Yen ticket per person on the New Koei Line to go to Shinjuku (to use JR pass). There are convenient stores located really near the hotel: Lawson, Family Mart. There is also a 100 Yen shop near the train station.So far, the stay was good and we really loved the helpful and polite staff. We can freely take the water in the cafe or buy our own instant noodle and use the hot water in the cafe.Thanks for the great stay!

Location is near central tokyo, only 2 station from shinjuku koei new line to hatagaya station, and from hatagaya station is less than 5 minutes walk. Overall value is fair enough. For breakfast i suggest more variance than bread.

The staff were warm, friendly and accommodating, providing helpful advice and assistance with anything I needed throughout my stay. I have visited this hotel a number of times over the last couple of years and have never felt let down by the staff, facilities or cleanliness. Being centrally located, this modest hotel has a great deal to offer, and despite its central location is quiet, which meant I could get a good nights sleep. Not only that, the food is delicious, with much of it being locally produced and organic. I'm already planning my next trip and I will almost certainly book another stay at the Sakura Hotel in Hatagaya. It is an excellent hotel with some of the most wonderful staff I have ever had the good fortune of meeting and it says a lot when you miss the staff as much as the country itself.

It was a very nice place, you have everything you need to rest after being around Tokyo. Also you can be part of different activities that are prepared for the guests so you will enjoy meeting new people while you discover everything about Japanese culture. If you need anything or have doubts, you can ask the staff, they are always in good mood to help you. I really liked that.

I first stayed at Sakura Hotel Ikebukuro in 2013 which familiarized me with the chain of hotels. I chose Hatagaya this time because of the location, and I was not disappointed. The room and bathroom was clean and ample for my stay. However, I must admit that the walls are quite thin as I could hear my neighbors enjoying their evening a little too loudly :P

Very nice environment, restaurants, 24hrs shops, postage office nearby. And outdoor eating area provided. Front desk receptionist are very nice and helpful.I like the rooms setting for day lights penetrate inside the room. Looks great and energetic in every morning before I go out.Thank you!

Had rather low expectations due to the low price compared with other hotels near by. Pleasantly surprised by the amenities and friendly staff! Definitely worth every penny. If I need a hotel next time, I'm going to go back!

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is a little far from the Shinjuku Transport Hub and because of this there is a time constraint set if you have no transport available except the subway which runs up 12mn. The rooms were a tight squeeze; comfortable and clean yet manageable. The staff were proficient in English and very knowledgeable about directions to and from destinations. However, because of the centralized heating and air-conditioning system you are unable to control the temperature of your room. I would come back when in Tokyo.

Convenient location, 1 min walk from Hatagaya metro station, which is 2 stations away from Shinjuku which takes you everywhere. Basic breakfast included but other meals are available if you like. Quiet place at night, no street noise either so perfect to sleep. All staff members speak a really good English and they are always available and helpful. I made a second reservation to extend my stay in a different room and they were kind enough to let me switch my bags before official check in time, thank you for that! Safe and convenient luggage storage by the way if you arrive early or need to catch a late plane after checking out. Nice walk through residential areas to reach Yoyogi park to get away from the fuss of Shinjuku and Shibuya which can be overwhelming after a while. I will definitely stay there next time I come to Tokyo!

The place is cute, a little shabby but charming. I like the 24 hour cafe and good location. It wasn't expensive, so I didn't have high expectations. We would have been happy with our room, except that the bathroom smelled TERRIBLE. Like, we're not picky. I tried to brush my teeth and almost hurled. After a few hours of being in our room and the smell not getting better, we asked to be transferred to a new room. At first the woman said they were full and it wasn't possible, but my boyfriend asked "can you check?" and the woman was like "oh, we do have a room." She didn't seem happy at all, and I understand that it is an inconvenience, but really if they hadn't wanted to move us they shouldn't have put us in the poo room. I did notice when we first went in the room, the window was open, so perhaps they thought it would air out before we got there, so that in itself is understandable, but the attitude wasn't cool. We got moved to a tiny room with a view of the stairwell, so we had to keep our curtains closed for privacy for our remaining 4 nights there. I really wanted to like this place, and it had some nice things about it, but the way they handled their mistake was unprofessional and left me a bit salty.

We booked the traditional Japanese room for our first few nights at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya and we're surprised and pleased at the size and amenities. 24 hour cafe with options for different diets and a prayer room made for a welcoming and inclusive environment. We had a six year old child who was well accommodated. Staff were helpful. Very close to transport and shops. We will return!

Room: Double Room CornerBed - Bed was spacious than I thought. It could fit me, my husband and my 1-year daughter. (Me and my husband is plus-size so I'm quite suprised it could fit us all three)Room - Room was great. It's completed with TV, refrigerator and couch.Location - Location was perfect as it's near the city area. Hotel only 5 min walk from Hatagaya station (Keio new line). Train station exit to the hotel is equipped with elevator.Cafe - Food was great. There was a quite variety of Halal menu so you can try different food everytime. The halal menu sold out fast so better try it as soon as you can.Laundry - Laundry is a bit dissapointing as it was very limited. Laundry only available at 5th floor, and they only have 2 washer and 2 dryer. The people on 5th floor seems to conquer it as I've encounter numerous case where the machine was done yet no one pick the clothes. Then when I check againb5 min later, someone else as put their clother into the machine. Laundry can only be done from 10am to 10pm so if you come back to hotel at 8pm, there's a slim chance. Laundy best done on 6pm or morning at 10am before you start your day. My advice, better bring enough clothes so you dont have to waste time fight for the laundry.Overall, the stay was great and we we having a good rest while staying at Sakura Hatagaya. Will definitely come here again.

I am happy with our stay in this hotel.There are other Filipinos who checked in with usStaff are friendly.Train station and bus stops are conveniently located walking distant on this hotel.Rooms are quite small, luggage can be placed underneath your bed.

Located 2 mins to Hatagaya station. Very nice staff. Free breakfast. Clean rooms and everyday room cleaning. High value for money. Good communications. Own cafe down stairs and good meals for reasonable price. I just checked out and i am so keen to provide this good feed back for them.

There are variety moslem food and mushola.Recomended hotel to stay at Tokyo.Very close to Hatagaya Station.The staffs were very helpful in giving information, someone can speak Indonesian language.Clean room and fresh towel everiday.Nice stay, Sakura Hotel Hatagaya was very pleasant.

The hotel was easily access drom metro stationbut close enough that we could walk to shibuya shopping area and Yoyogi park. Only negative thing for us was the breakfast which was only soup, coffee or tea and bread. Room was very small for two people not enough plugs to charge phones and cameras in the room. We had drinks before bed in a bar close to the hotel called wild bushy pretty nice lady runs the bar very friendly and speaks very good english.

Old hotel, small rooms, simple accommodation, yet a clean well looked after property. Comfy bed, and a good shower/bath, was all I needed. Excellent friendly staff that give the place a real “travellers vibe” with their eagerness to help and have a chat. So many happy travellers have stayed and left photos and notes on the walls of the reception. 24 hour lobby cafe, with a world class selection of craft beers, and a simple yet extensive cafe food menu with many recipes that guests have given over the years. Was comfortable and felt at home here. Will stay again next month. Hope the internet is a little faster when I return. The WiFi in the room was a little slow,, but hanging out downstairs at the cafe had faster connection.

The place was great! It’s just a 1 minute walk from Hatagaya Station. It’s near to Family mart and kitchen origin. On top of that, the hotel staffs were all very welcoming and accommodating. Would definitely come back here !

Friendly staff. This is great place to stay for moslem because they provide halal food. The hotel also close to train station and convenient store. I went there for holiday and spent so much time outside from morning to late night, the hotel should consider the laundry time so laundry can be access anytime for guest.

I loved my stay here everything was perfect. My room was clean I must have helped me with translating some stuff. The quality of service I received here is on par with some of the five star hotels I've been to, sometimes Superior

just a few subway stops from Shinjuku, or a short bus/taxi ride from shibuya, away from tourist traps so you get experience a bit of the real Japan, 24hr bar/restaurant is convenient, as well as its location to transport, laundry, stores etc. If you're new to Japan don't be put off by the tiny rooms, that's normal. staff are helpful and friendly.

I stayed at the fantastic Sakura Hotel at Hatagaya. It was just right for my needs. Friendly staff, small compact room with en suite and easy access to the hub at Shinjuku. For a traveller having laundry facilities available and a 24 hour cafe it was perfect.

This hotel has not only English speaking staff but some of the nicest staff I have ever dealt with. The rooms are exactly what you need and they even off free breakfast. Not only that but the train station is a short walk away with other food and bar amenities close as well. When I come back, this is definitely where I'm staying.

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is a sweet and warming home in Hatagaya, Tokyo. It was cheap and near the train station which made it very accessible and easy to get around Tokyo. Convenience Stores were everywhere which made us easy to buy our everyday essentials.Also, the Staff are friendly and nice. It was my friend's birthday eve so, we decided to celebrate on their very own mini cafe when they heard us singing a birthday song for our friend, they surprised everyone with a bottle of nice sparkling champagne. Everyone had a good time,

good location and the staff very friendly only the breakfast is bread & sop but overall is a nice place ..we love to stay here only 2 station from shinjuku and many store around this area you can easy to find near the hatagaya station

Rooms are smallish and beds are typically Japanese (a bit firm), but the price is reasonable, location is great, and staff were awesome. Feels like a hostel but with much nicer rooms and of course with the usual hotel considerations. Bar and cafe are a nice addition; like the hotel, not fancy, but friendly and nice. Highly recommended if you aren't looking for luxury (but we felt happy to come back to our room to rest and relax at the end of each day).

The first time i entered the Hotel, it had a very Warm, cozy and Homely vibe to it. This atop the Super friendly staff made me feel as if i were staying at a home away from home.Coming from a country where we have huge houses, i did find the room quite small, but then again, cant complain it being Tokyo. I actually liked the room, although it is small, it has all amenities you would need.The Food at the hotel is pretty good and they also have a wide selection of beers( Local beers and international ones).The hotel does come with Complementary Breakfast which is quite amazing considering the inexpensive price , but there is room for improvement.More variety can be added.The hotel is a mere 2 minute walk from the Hatagaya Metro station, which is one of the best things about the hotel, this makes it very accessible to any district via the metro. There are lot of Convenience stores and eateries close by too.The hotel staff are just amazing and very friendly, they were always there to help.Overall i would say this hotel has a great value for money, considering its prime location;Great for tourists who require a place to sleep after a day of site seeing.

Great budget hotel. Very accessible since train station is about 2 mins walk. Hotel staff were very accommodating and friendly. Food in the cafe was good too. Family Mart and reataurants available in the area about 1 minute away.

The hotel is simple and clean, located close to the Hatagaya station with a lot of reasonably priced eateries around. Friendly English speaking staff, who is very willing to share info with the guests.

very nice, comfortable, the staff is friendly and very helpful and serves halal food. if there is a chance to return to Japan, we will choose to stay there again. I hope this good quality will be maintained.

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is really a great place to stay. It's value for money. The location is fantastic near Hatagaya station which is only 2 stops away from Shinjuku. The surrounding area is safe and have convenient stores and cafes/restaurants all within walking distance. The staff are friendly, helpful and able to communicate in English. We had an earthquake experience while staying here but the staff is able to explain and provide us assurance that everything is fine. My only suggestion for improvement is on the daily breakfast which could offer more variety in different days eg. oats or cereals. The room is small but then again that is expected for the price that you pay in Tokyo. Overall, this is a great place for family to stay and will definitely consider Sakura Hotel Hatagaya if I ever come to Tokyo again.

Nice Location, friendly staff and best price include breakfast.. this is the second time I'm select Sakura Hotel.. Both time also having a great moment when stay here.. strongly recommend for who travel to Tokyo soon...

This is my second stay at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya and I enjoyed my stay again. The only thing I missed though was the halal curry rice from Sakura Cafe which I loved during my first stay. I hope they would bring it back if I ever come back again. It was really delicious.

We found this to be a good value option when travelling with our 4 kids. We booked a triple room and a twin room and had the kids in one room (2 shared the double bed which was a reasonable size, the others had full-size single beds) and we had the twin room. The twin room had a double bed (which was a good size for the two of us) and a single. The rooms were small but clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are very small but adequate. The hotel is close to the subway making it a great base to explore Tokyo. Staff are friendly and helpful.

A great location to stay, close to city centre and most importantly to a subway station. Breakfast is provided but it’s really basic to get you started for the day, don’t expect a full course breakfast.

The room was a good size. The air conditioner worked wonderfully and the bed was comfortable.Staff are easy to talk to, helpful. Hotel location is great, can take the train to most locations or a 30-minute-ish walk to Shibuya station and the food, entertainment and shopping there.I was there for New Years, and there were cultural experiences available and staff ready to answer questions or offer something unique.The bathroom did sometimes have a smell from the pipes, but it wasn't severe. The cleaning staff were also super friendly and sweet, and did their jobs very efficiently.

Stayed here with wife and 2 kids. The rooms were small but kept to a good standard. Very clean and tidy. Friendly staff who can speak English. Convenient cafe. Free wi-fi and internet access. Conveniently located to local eateries, supermarkets and Hatagaya station on the Keio New Line - 2 stops from Shinjuku. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

The staffs was very friendly and helpful, and I will probably return in the future. I will had given them a rating of 4 but unfortunately that my room was plague with tiny cockroaches for 4 days, which really doesn't help with my experience there. Otherwise, the other thing I dislike was the transportation, it take quite a few days to figure out an optimal path in Shinjuku station to get the right line to Hatagaya Station, and it's not recommended for ppl with big and heavy luggages to navigate through.

The only thing I don’t like was the transportation going to the property. It’s true that it is located close to the hatagaya station but that station is not included in the ticket package, means that you have to buy an extra ticket When go out and come back the hotel but still not a big issue. Apart from this everything were acceptable and reasonable.

Friendly Muslim hotel.Value for money.Recommended for those Muslim travellers coming to Tokyo,Japan.Nearby halal food in Shinjuku and Shibuya.Easy to travel around as the hotel is located near Shinjuku n shinuya

We visited more than 20 hotels during our stay and this one was the best by far. Staff was super friendly and hotel was clean and well located. Would definitly recommend and go again sometimes. There is a cafe/ bar in the lobby. We were alowed to stay there for more than 12hours after our stay because of a delayed flight.

Nice, clean hotel. Tiny rooms, but normal for Tokyo. Well-located not too far from Shinjuku (though it's easy to get confused between Keio and New Keio lines...). The 24-hour cafe is a nice extra.Overall I was happy with my stay.

I was staying in this hotel about 6nights and actually it was really goodOne of the biggest reason is locationHotel is located really good place in Tokyo it’s not far from center of Tokyo and just two stations from shinjuku and 5 stations from shibuya and staffs are really kind and also they can speak many languages every staffs can speak English and some other languagesI will back to Tokyo next July again and I will choose this hotel again!I hope you guys will choose this hotel!This price for staying one of the best hotel in Tokyo

Sakura Cafe has an interesting menu for latte, Also they provide 2 computers for guests' use. So we can really chill out while doing work here. I shall try out all the lattes here! First one is of course green tea latte.

The young staff - namely Ms Natsuko, Mr Takehara and Mr Hoka - at the front desk are friendly and made us feel so at home. The cafe is also welcoming. It makes my family of 5 feel special. I work with youths around the world and these young staff has made this place so trendy and happening - complete with Takoyaki party! Good job, Ms Natsuko, Mr Takehara and Mr Hoka!

Overall, good hotel to stay in. Has facilities like laundromat, prayer room, Muslim-friendly food. Staff are helpful and friendly. Tried the cafe food. The chorrillana and keema was delicious. Provided breakfast of breads with coffee or tea rather simple though found it generally as good enough.

Great value for money. Good location near hatagaya station, family mart, sakuya resto, dotour coffeeshop. Celfone with wifi provided in each room was a big help for us in navigating tokyo. Great staff, speaks and understands english.

Its location is great: close to the train station and Shinjuku is two stations away; good restaurants and coffee shops nearby; parks small and large (Yoyogi Part 20-25 minute walk and good for exercise). Staff are courteous and efficient in providing assistance needed.

friendly and helpful hotel staff, fluent in English (can hear clearly)clean room, comfortable, but its a little bit small for 2 peoplegood breakfast, loved the variant of teanear from station, only 2 min walk

This hotel has an onsite café and very helpful staff. It is in a good part of town, close to a train station. There are good restaurants within walking distance, and great shopping a couple of train stops away. I would definitely stay here again!

Great location! Love that it’s still urban but quiet and low-key. Walking-distance to the train station.Great restaurants close by. A Tomod’s and two 7-Eleven stores close by. The perfect little town to walk around in at night.The actual accommodations were simple and plain, but did the job (only for sleeping). My family and I (9 in total) booked 5 rooms (1-2 per room). The rooms were quite small (the room only fit the queen size bed, a small table/desk, and a very narrow walkway). The bathrooms were tiny! The bathtub/shower could barely fit a person, but, again, did the job. The only issue we had was the smell of cigarettes. Even though our rooms were smoke-free, it still reeked of old, stale cigarette smoke. We got used to it, but it was quite repulsive when we first checked in. In general, the rooms and bathrooms were clean.They had washing machines and dryers, but we did not use them because some were out of order and the functioning ones were beaten up/dirty from other guests.The complimentary, continental breakfast was simple. They provided different types of bread (you can toast them), butter, different types of jelly, soup, tea, and coffee. It was a nice, quick breakfast before venturing out for the day.They have a larger menu (for purchase), but we never tried it. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and welcoming. They all spoke English well. Most guests were English-Speaking American or European. A lot of young backpackers.Overall, a great budget hotel in a nice area!Love Hatagaya!But when I revisit Tokyo, I think I’d stay someplace else.

The place was clean, the staff were nice, the wifi was fast. Do not expect too much for the breakfast; it is just coffee, bread, and jam. The room though is very very small. Not overreacting or anything, but it is really small. We just placed our luggages under the bed so we could have more space for ourselves; but still it was too small for us to move around. The place was a bit far from Shibuya and Shinjuku, but easily accessible by train.

Hotel is located in a quiet residential area, 2 stops away from Shinjuku. Room has everything that I needed, but not spacious (as expected, given that the location is near Shinjuku).Breakfast was horrible. Only plain breads / buns and butter / jams were provided. Drinks were hot coffee or iced water only. It was so bad that I never returned for breakfast after that, I rather spent some $$$ to get better food outside. Afterall, this is a nice friendly hotel in a neighbourhood near Shinjuku. Nothing exciting nearby, but there are sufficient shops or eating places when you need to find one.

3 reasons to return to Sakura Hotel:> Cozy - staff are friendly and helpful. Plenty of information displayed for travelers to pickup. > Convenient - there few cafes and restaurants nearby for meals. > Strategically located nearby Hatagaya station

I really liked this place - so clean, fresh new robes and slippers everyday, warm toilet seats, superb location just a few steps from Shibuya station. The only downside of this hotel is the space. Like most rooms in japan, it is quite small, moreso with the toilet & bath. But above it all, you still get great value for your money. I have recommended this hotel to many of my friends!

Stayed in Sakura Hotel Hatagaya for 4 nights and I could say I got good value for what I paid for. The hotel is very very near the train station which is very convenient as you dont need to carry your luggage far or when youre tired after a whole day of walking. Yes room and bathroom is on the smallish side but I kinda expected it already. Lots of restaurants nearby. Breakfast is very light - bread, jam, coffee/tea and soup, but if you want to have more there is a Family Mart nearby anyway. Staff are very friendly, can help you call a cab if you need one.

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is just 2 station away from Shinjuku station. If you are one of those people who wants 5 star accommodation for a 3 star hotel budget then this hotel is NOT for you. The staff is extremely helpful, speak in English, kind and polite. There is a common area for smoking right in front of the hotel entrance (which will annoy some non-smoker) but business is business, they cater for all sorts of travellers. Free breakfast are limited only to Breads, jams, butter, coffees, tea and soup. My wife and I would like to thank its management for making our stay very comfortable.

Hi, I stayed at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya for 2 nights and although overall the stay was enjoyable, there are some pros and cons that I would like to share with other travelers:Pros:- super close to subway- handy rental phone provided - convenience stores at your doorstep- room was tidy and clean- friendly staff who speak good English . Cons:- room was super small and yes, I’m aware that most hotels in japan are small but for the double room that we had, the only way to open our luggages is by putting them on top of each other and open one at a time.- breakfast is below average: only bread and some jam, butter. Anything more “fancy” such as boiled eggs will cost extra which i find very cheeky. To be honest , i would be more happy if they did not include breakfast in the price. - hotel is close to subway which is great but just be aware that this hotel is not on the JR line. Still need to take subway to get to the central part of Shibuya. - the room was not sound proof. I could hear people in other room do their washing. - the price is a little expensive after considering all the cons above.

This is our 2nd times for stayed at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya. I like this hotel because of the location is near from restaurant, Hatagaya Station, and Shinjuku. The staffs are very friendly especially Hoka. Maybe next time, we will stay at this hotel and recommend this hotel to our friends. どうもありがとうございます。

Excellent service by the staff!! Hotel location is really close to Hatagaya station and plenty of shops around for dine out. Hotel provided a free phone with calls facility, wifi is good as well. However Hatagaya station is not covered by JR pass so had to buy separate ticket to get to main train lines like Shinjuku every time wanted to go anywhere. Also room was so small that couldn't open the bag unless on top of the bed. The free breakfast was pretty basic bread rolls, jam and margarine, coffee and a soup. Overall had a good time due to the friendliness of staff.

My very first time in Tokyo, so this place was extremely great. Close position to the center and wonderful calmness in the nearby streets. Simple and cozy place. Great room service and I was lucky with the window view; I know not every room has it.

Very good qualiy/price relation for Tokyo. Clean, close to metro, very friendly and helpful staff speaking perfect English. Nice restauraunt. The hotel provides a smartphone for the duration of the stay, isn't that great? Minor disadvantages: basically no window: it was facing another building which was so close I could touch it with my hand. Location: although metro stop is close, it is not too practical (anywhere you go, must change at Shinjuku).

It is the best hotel in Japan. It gives muslim halal food and other international food from around the world. They gave great service and staffs are all so friendly. The room is clean and the price is valuable.

The whole living is very good, I enjoy a wonderful trip. The hotel is very close to the metro station and a Family-Mart, and near the hotel there has many restaurants, you can find everything you like.

We had a great time in this hotel! The staff were very friendly and were more than willing to help. I even had a small chat with one of their staffs who was into watch collecting. The bread and coffee breakfast is something I liked and appreciated. Overall, this a great and affordable place, highly recommended.Arigatou Gozaimasu Sakura Hotel!!

Of all the hotels we've stayed at, Sakura Hotel Hatagay is by far the best in terms of value for money and location (i.e. Hotel is only a 2min walk to Hatagaya Sta. and is only 1 stop to Shinjuku Sta. which is also a good choice of "base"" when going around Tokyo).Okay, the above may sound a bit cliche but this hotel tops in terms of activities and events (depending on the dates of your stay) that guests can participate in - Yes, my family participated in the local Mikoshi Festival arranged by the Hotel for FREE. We never expected a hotel offering such and it was one unforgettable experience. Shout out to the staff - Sitoshi, Waga, Hako, Arai and Risa - you guys are awesome!Another plus for me is the FREE use of Travel Buddy Phone which is very very useful when finding places to eat, places to visit, train / bus stations among others and you can even access gmail accounts as well.

The service was great the staff was awesome. Hoca and Lim were two God sent people. They were so easy to talk to and answered all our questions and spoke very good english. Lim gave good advice on where to eat and what attractions to see. Hoca helped with transportation to the airport. Sakura is so very lucky to have both of you. The rooms were small but according to Japan standards it was considered good size. The rooms were clean and housekeeping was on it. The 24 hour cafe was good just enough breakfast stuff to get you going and lunch and dinner menu was good. They also have a big variety of beer and hard liquor to choose from. The train station is right around the corner lot of convenient stores and restaurants in the vicinity. A little gem of a find would stay again. Mahalo and Aloha from Honolulu, Hi.

Decent bed and room, if small, though not unexpected in central Tokyo. Friendly staff. Well-located for visiting the city. There was only one pillow, so a second could have helped, though that is a minor issue. Overall very reasonably priced (around US$65 per night) for central Tokyo!

Private ensuite room for this price is very hard to come by for Tokyo, they get snapped up very fast even if they do exist. Location was excellent! 2 stops from Shinjuku, short distance from train station, surrounded by lots of different eating places, there's even a supermarket and convenience store round the corner. Pharmacy and post office? Checked! Staff were very polite and helpful The only small peeve i had was, the cold water pressure is weak, especially on tap mode. Sometimes gotta wait a while for the water to flow, especially after flushing. Could be 'cos i was on the top floor.

Very good value for this hotel. Very cozy atmosphere at 24/7 open cafe’ where lots of guest gather for a last drink.The staff sounds to be addicted to happiness, spreading good vibe all over the hotel.

Sakura Hotel is located in a quiet charming little street one station away from Shinjuku. Right next to a metro line, lots of restaurants, a convenience store, a great public pool and gym, and a bakery. The cafe downstairs is cozy, open 24/7 and has a wide variety of international foods. Staff is very helpful and speaks many languages. Our review rating was lowered by the rooms. They were tiny, there was no room even for two bags. Also, no shelving or proper clothes storage facilities exist in the room. The carpet was a bit old and made the room smell of dust. Overall the stay was enjoyable but the layout of the rooms needs serious improvement.

I stayed at the hotel for a week and enjoyed the experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was also very convenient, it is close to the shops and Hatagaya station. It is very easy to travel from the location, it is 2 stops away from Shinjuku. From the airport, you can get the express bus to Shinjuku and then change to the metro line. It is a lot cheaper than getting a taxi. The hotel offers breakfast every morning and the cafe is open all day for anything you may need. There are also washing machines and dryers which cost 100 yen to use. Overall a very good place to stay and I would highly recommend.

The hotel staff very friendly and helpful to us. This hotel very convenient for us because it is close to the train station, pharmacy and mart. In conclusion, we recommend this hotel to other tourists when you're at Tokyo.

We decided to stay here on a recommendation from friends who had stayed the previous year. We were late to book our trip so decided to go for a "sure bet." We stayed in a double room. It was priced fairly. Not very central and you must access small subway line to see any sights. Breakfast was very basic...coffee was nice in the morning. Only unfortunate surprise was the cleanliness of the washroom. At first I thought the shower was just stained, however, upon some light cleaning with tissue, the shower wall clearly hadn't been washed in a while. Brown stains (that were easily removable) all around :( Aside from this and a light smell to the room, it is a decent place to stay on a budget in Tokyo.

hotel was very near to hatagaya station, plus very near to family mart, tomods, lawsons which made our stay very smooth. breakfast buffet was a bit unsatisfactory but was free...room was a bit small but overall bang for the buck. was also able to use the washing machine and dryer. for a small price.

Great place to stay in Tokyo: the privacy, service and cleanliness of a hotel, but the atmosphere of a hostel! Especially the bar that is opened 24/7 is a nice advantage of this hotel. Would definitely recommend this place.

Better to reduce price as the room size is too small. Also, the cleanliness of outside could be kept as more satisfactory. The price ix extremely higher than many other hotels. But the mobile phone service in the room system is very appreciable and helpful to the customers.

Rooms aren't spacious, so it might be uncomfortable if you're big and tall. But value for price is the best. You get a full-size bed with private bathroom, TV and fridge, all while being right next to the train station. Breakfast was very limited, just bread and jam. But for a wanderer tourist, this is all you need.

The Good. Mainly the location, which is close to the Hatagaya station.The Bad.My biggest complaint goes with the room size. I booked a double room, and when I entered the room I was rather shocked. I'm used to rooms in Japan being small (I've been to Japan several times), but in this case the bed occupied like 90% of the room, and there was no space left to open the luggage. Essentially I had to lift the bed to open the luggage.The Internet was bad, especially at night when other people were using it.The breakfast is a joke. The only solid thing they have is bread! Moreover there are only two extremely slow toasting machines, so in the morning everyone is essentially queueing to get the bread toasted.The staff was ok, but well below the japanese standards. The last day I needed a taxi and asked the reception if they could book one for me. The lady at the reception made a phone call and then told me that there were no Taxi available! On a Wednesday morning in central Tokyo, that is just simply unbelievable. She just called a random company and gave up without making any effort to call another place and find a taxi.And I paid more than 10000 Yen/night, which is not a cheap price for a budget hotel in Tokyo.

We stayed at 2 hotels while in Tokyo. The other was Citadines Shinjuku. It was so much nicer!! Bigger room, a kitchenette, nice to have 2 sinks with a family of 3. The bathroom at Citadines was bigger and had a Toto washlet toilet which we've come to expect in Japan.

I went here with large group of people and they where great help for the 18 of us. They let us store our bags inside when we arrived early were a great help. The breakfast is simple and delicious. They have great menu in the cafe with various foods and international drinks.would stay here

First the good. This is an excellent location, with easy access to a subway line that takes you directly to Shinjuku. It's also clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the rooms are adequate for the casual traveler. It also has a nice sitting area outside where you can socialize, as well as its own cafe. All in all, a good place to stay. Now for the negative. Last Friday night (July 20th) I stayed at the Sakura Hotel in Hatagaya. My boyfriend and I had reserved a double room through the Agoda booking site for one night. When I checked in and went to the room, I was very upset to find that the room I was assigned was not actually a double room, but a single room. Yet I was charged the price for a double.I have stayed at the same Sakura Hotel before, in a double room, so I noticed the size difference in both the size of the room and the size of the bed right away. And to be clear, I am aware that the size of hotel rooms in Tokyo are smaller than in other countries. I have lived and worked in Japan for 25 years, and have traveled extensively both as a single traveler for business trips and as a couple for vacations. This means I am well aware of the standard sizes for both double and single rooms across Japan. This room was definitely a single room being used for double occupancy. I did not complain to the clerk at the time as I know he is not the person who is in charge of making the decision to sell single rooms for double occupancy at the price of a double room. I suspect this could be a decision made higher up at corporate, or it could be that Agoda is the dishonest party here, selling off single hotel rooms as doubles and then pocketing the difference. I complained via email to the Sakura House corporate office and hope to receive a reply from them. Meanwhile, people booking this hotel via Agoda should be aware that this is happening and factor it into their decision making process. Only you can decide if the good points outweigh the bad. Also, if you are booking through Agoda or other booking site, check the Sakura House website as well and double check the prices - you can see they are different right away.

Sakura Hotel was great for a two star hotel. It was relatively cheap since hotel is quite expensive in Japan. Very close to Hatagaya Station, restaurants and 24 hours convenience store. The room was nice, I stayed in a twin bed room, large bed for me, my wife and my kid. Though the bed was kinda take the whole space, makes you hard to walk around the room but it has enough space to put all your luggage and shoes. The bathroom was pretty small but it was okay. The room sizes in Japan is different from other countries, they're smaller.It has 24 hours front desk service and food at the restaurant (no room service). The food was quite expensive, but the taste was good and quite large portion. I ordered fish and chips, I don't. Know what kind of fish it was but it wasn't just a plain dory fillet, it was other fish that cooked very well and fresh. The calamari salad was surprisingly not squid but octopus. It was great.This is definitely recommended budget hotel in Japan!

Nice place to stay. Clean with small room. Friendly staffs.... also we can smoke in front of lobby... lovely place lah ........ free tea and coffee anytime. Near MRT (+/- 100 m) and many small resto/cafe surround that place.

One thing that you'll find being constantly told in their feedback reviews as the selling point is that the Hotel is near Shinjiku and Shibuya, which is true. It takes less than 5-10 minutes from the Hatagaya station which is great if you want to access major areas in Tokyo. Surprisingly the room was bigger than I thought it was, which is good considering its a budget hotel and I was carrying a lot of luggage. The hotel is very near many areas like conveniences stores, laundromat (their own laundromat opens from 10am-10pm only), post office and box if you need to mail back those 4G Pocket Wifi's or other stuff, and many food joints nearby. It's also a 10-15 minutes walk to the Tokyo Camii, which is great for Muslim travelers. The Sakura Hotel Cafe is also a good alternative since it operates 24/7 if you are tired to go out to look for food. The cafe also provides a good alternative for Muslim travels because of their halal selection menu, although finding halal food in Tokyo is much easier now compared to before thanks to the internet. There's a also a Muslim prayer room in the cafe while you wait. They also provided a lot of other facilities like handy, an integrated mobile device that helps you to navigate the city free of charge, activities and tour trips. A commendable effort and initiative from the hotel to the customers and I'll give credit where its due.However, even though I didn't want to expect much since this is a 2 star hotel, the breakfast selection was a big disappointment; a few choices of jams, coffee, bread and butter. While the cafe its open 24/7 and there's quite a number of selections of food, the staff at the reception has to constantly juggle back and forth between the food counter and the reception counter, which makes it awkward and inconvenient. Cleanliness for the room is somewhat passable but there was a fly in my room when I checked in and while I was drinking my drink in the cafe, a bug actually entered my drink. The aircon was weird and had a constant "clean filter" sign on the device and I coughed a lot compared to my other hotel stays. Security and safety wise very concerning because when I arrived early at the hotel I put my baggage in the luggage storage area, but the fact I can freely go in back and forth to get my stuffs in the luggage area without any supervision tells you a lot of their security level, even though the crime rate in Japan is generally low. Very average to low hospitality and service from staff, which is something I don't expect from Japanese people. Staff friendliness depends on the people and some of the staff do not have the Japanese level hospitality and courtesy. The Wifi internet connection speed is unstable and slow, got disconnected many times while using it.If you on a budget and looking a budget accommodation with easy access to subway and other facilities, you can put this hotel under consideration but be caution of the flaws it has. With its price however, I think you can get a better option if you look hard enough.

First in Japan and we are so happy with Sakura Hatagaya. Expecting that the room will be small, with 1 double bed and 2 single bed, the room has enough space for our luggages and to move around. The toilet is very small but the impt thing is overall , everything is clean.Hotel is very accessible to a 3min walk to train, restos & groceries around & Mcdonalds nearby.Will definitely stay here or their other branches next time. Very happy with Sakura Hatagaya.

Pretty nice. Kind, friendly staffs.There’s nice local bars near the hotel too...I’m not sure about the name of that bar but had pretty nice collection of Jamaican music LP collection.The hotel’s location is very near Hatagaya station. Hatagaya is also quite near Shinjuku and Shibuya too. Actually I walked all the way to Omotesando and Harajuku, and the road to there is also nice.There’s nothing really good or bad about the room itself. But it was clean and pretty cozy.

Clean and nice place. Have family mart nearby and close to hatagaya station which is really convenient. Muslim friendly as well. If you stay in small room it is quite cramp to perform prayer. The prayer room is clean as well. The muslim friendly food at the cafe also good. Though I hope the menu will have more variety.

Near train station, lots of shops/grocery and dining places around the area. Room has everything you need albeit the room being small. Staff were friendly, polite and trustworthy. We enjoyed our 7 nights stay and will definitely recommend this hotel for those traveling on a budget.

The basic things you expect from a budget hotel are always satisfying. Although the room are not so big the conditions and atmosphere was perfect! While the price of accommodation is important for hotel reservations, there are good things to offer at the hotel. They have a homely cafe on the first floor which different guests from the world meet and serves international food.What is best about this hotel can offer are the hotel staffs. I have experienced many hotels. In my opinion, The staff's kindness and friendliness in this hotel is truly admirable.(Special tip : Looking for a staff named Hoka is fantastic.He can speak many different languages.)I'm sure you'll agree with me.And if you are planning a trip to the Tokyo on a budget, then go to this hotel without fail. You'll be fully satisfied and think the same way. I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed a week at Hotel Sakura in Hatagaya, and were very happy with the pricetag and service from the staff. Sure, it isn´t the most luxurious of hotels (can´t expect that for the price!), but it is OK. I mean, we just use the room for sleeping during the Tokyo vacation, so no need for luxurious rooms IMHO. The breakfast could have had a wider range to choose from... Not sure if it was because of the kitchen being renovated? If the breakfast was better, I´d give it a five star rating. Ah, well.Very friendly staff, close to both small shops and Hatagaya station, room cleaning every day. And all this for a good price. If I´d ever visit Tokyo again, I would probably look for Sakura hotels again.

Good location, about 150 meters from Hatagaya Station. Near of restaurant and mini market 24 hour. A room is very clean, frendly staff with English and Bahasa Indonesia. Near of mosque too. Perfect!!!

It was nice ‘coz it is near to subway. Strawberry jam was really awesome as well. Me & my girlfriend really enjoyed sakura hotel it has a free pocket wifi which is very helpful especially for the tourists. Staffs were really friendly. We will surely comeback to this hotel.

Room was small as what is the norm in most Japanese hotel rooms. It has a TV, AC, toiletries & hair dryer. Location was fairly close to the subway, lotsa convenience stores and restaurants nearby. Breakfast consisted of bread, soup, coffee or tea. Good value for money!

Very small room as normal in Japan, I had stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and this room was smaller than the one previous. In this room there was no access to the double bed from both sides, ie a climbing excercise during the night is not an ideal way to spend your holiday.

Not aure the actual material of the mattress but bamboo or some sort of lumber.Poor wifi that worked better/connected in the shower.Breakfast is toast/coffee and misoNice area and close to the trainParking is ¥200 and hour up the street at the convenience store

Easily accessible from the main lines, only have to walk a very short distance from the end station. Small rooms, which is efficient, because really; who stays in their hotelroom while visiting this city? Maybe those who travel for work and crunch in the evenings will find the roomsSmall, but there seem to be some rooms that are bigger and have bigger desks, no matter, the rooms are a great size even for this gigantic foreigner. The staff is friendly and manages the english language well, and help with most basic stuff, and other things as well like translating a temple fortune :)Another great feature was the ”Handy” phone that we got with the room, it’s an android phone that you can bring with you to use google maps and their search engine. Very(!)helpful in this town. We where saved many times by ミスターハンジイー, and the experience was made more pleasant for it because we knew we had that phone to navigate (PS. Google maps is very helpful when it comes to navigate Tokyos train and subway-system). Anyway, great place, would very well go there again, when I go to Japan once more.

Good Value, Budget Friendly Hotel in Shibuya area of Tokyo (2nd time staying here). Nice neighborhood location (live like a local), restaurants and amenities on your doorstep, 5 minute walk to subway station. If you enjoy walking, Yoyogi Park, Omotosendo/Harajuku an interesting 40 min walk.

This wasn't my first choice, I was going to go around Japan on my own and I wanted a hotel near enough the station so I won't have to spend too much time should I get lost...and I am so thankful I did book this hotel!!! very near the Hatagaya station which is the most convenient part of traveling. there's a post office next to the hotel, Family Mart is at the corner, a 24hr supermarket is at the station and also a 24hr McDonald's which is very convenient. I just wish I had time to explore the area more, but I was running on sched and I promised myself I would stay here again.The room is not that big, but you get what you paid for and you go out leaving the room messy and come back and it'll all be cleaned and all supplies re-stocked. I would suggest this hotel to friends or family who would tour Tokyo, the price is reasonable, the hotel is clean and the location is really excellent. There a lot of restaurant in the area, you don't have to worry about not being able to buy food and supplies.

Near to Hatagaya Station. Room rates are reasonable. Kettle, iron and ironing board available at counter. For muslim, there are prayer room at ground level, near to the toilet. Provide halal menu. Overall Sakura Hatagaya is good.

The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff were friendly and spoke English well. The 'breakfast included' consisted of bread, soup, coffee and tea. There was a free handy phone available in the room to use during my stay which was really helpful and had excellent wifi.

This is budget hotel where located near from Hatagaya station. It was moslem friendly place since they have prayer room and sell some halal food/snack. Staff were friendly and speak English fluently. However room was to small for 4-5 people.

Sakura Hotel Hatagaya is highly recommended for its accessible location for city spots. Staffs are very friendly and accomodating. Our one-week stay is worth it and we will surely book this hotel again for our next visit in Tokyo.

Hotel staff is great at English, which is a boon for people who don't know Japanese. The rooms were fine, although the bathroom can be a bit cramped if you're tall. The hotel café offers a good variety of international dishes. The hotel (along with the other branches) also hosts a variety of events, like a traditional hanami or mochi pounding, which are great fun to join. Exploring Tokyo was easy with a metro station close by, two stops from Shinjuku.This was my first hotel experience and I had a great time. Thank you to the Sakura Hotel staff.

We stayed there for 7 days. We had an amazing experience. The cleaning staff are always on time for their service. They see to it that our room is clean every single day. All their receptionists speak English so it’s really a plus because they were able to help us in logistics stuff.

Our room was very small, but comfortable enough. Everything was compact and useful. The breakfast is a bit limited (only white breads and coffee/tea), with some broth, but for the price of the stay, not too bad. The staff spoke good English and was very friendly.

A very short walk from the Hatagaya train station. Breakfast is VERY basic. If you want anything other than toast, you’ll have to order from another menu which costs more. I think our breakfast was included in the price so we weren’t too bothered about eating just bread/toast each morning. Plenty of tea and coffee available 24/7. Rooms are very small but that is common in Japan from our understanding. Bed was quite firm and possibly too hard for some. Staff were lovely!! Free wifi. We would stay again if we were to come back.

This is the fourth year I have used this hotel while travelling with my son on a Ski Trip. I see no reason to change. Friends told me about it and I have used both the singe and double rooms, the lower floor rooms facing the adjacent building can be a little dark but they are also good for sleeping.

Breakfast did not qualify as "continental" even. Just toast, rolls, french bread and coffee. The coffee quality was very good however, and maid service excellent. Clean room and sheets daily, and when the maid noticed our comforter was worn she replaced it with a new one. We appreciated that. Staff was friendly also.

It was my first trip to Tokyo and I was researching for budget hotels which served Halal meals and came across Sakura Hotel Hatagaya. I decided to choose them and was not disappointed. It is located in a quiet neighbourhood near Hatagaya station so it was very convenient for me to head out to Shinjuku. In front of the hotel is a convenience store which I frequent during my stay there. The room and toilet were small but good enough for someone on a solo trip and need a place to crash after sightseeing. The bed is comfortable enough for me to sleep in. You can borrow an electric kettle and iron from the reception. The only heads up I wish I had was to turn on the heater once I entered the room. It was winter when I was staying there. I was under the impression that the heater was on by default (centralised heater) as my room was quite warm when I first entered it during the afternoon. But it turned out that the heat came from the sunlight shining into my room which was located at the corner. It got really cold in the middle of the night and I tried "adjusting" the heater but it didn't work. I later realised on the 2nd night that I had to turn on the heater (the light on the thermostat had to be on) and was able to sleep comfortably. The Halal food was ok but I wish there was more variety. Other than that I actually enjoyed my stay and considered it my "home" while I was in Tokyo. I would definitely return again to this hotel when I'm visiting Tokyo.

Good location, just 2 to 3 minutes walk to Hatagaya Station, which is 2 stations away from Shinjuku Station. Very friendly staff, basic breakfast. If you want more for breakfast, Family Mart is just 1 minute walk from the hotel, and there are few restaurants and cafe around the hotel which open till late night.The only problem is the room size. If you carry a medium to big size luggage, you may have problems to find a space in the room to put your luggage, once you place the luggage on the floor, there is no space for you to walk.

awesome place, awesome staff, awesome guests, awesome food and drinksfrom all over the world: Japanese, Italian, German, vegetarian, halal.Included 24h cafe is great for relaxing, hanging out, or working.

Stayed for 6 days. Reception people were courteous and polite, typical Japanese traits. Rooms were small but clean and neat. Breakfast is simple just like my breakfast in the Philippines. The rate is reasonable. It is near to Hatagaya Station. Very convenient.

Small but nice place and clean, it is very close to Hatagaya train station. The breakfadt bread are very nice and i love the hot chocolate. The staffs can speak Functional English, one time the staff is from foreign background.

Small but comfortable, the rooms at Sakura Hotel Hatagaya are not luxurious by any means. But if you want a low cost option that's convenient and staffed by a lot of friendly, welcoming people this is the place to be. It's in a quiet neighborhood easily reached from Shinjuku and it makes a fantastic home base for exploring some of the most vital areas of Tokyo-- Shibuya, Harajuku, Shinjuku and Ikebukuro and beyond. A nice restaurant, a super low cost room, lots of fun to be had. I highly recommend this hotel.

Me and my boyfriend enjoyed staying here. Location is perfect and view from the room was beautiful. Only thing what I didnt like was the bathroom. Location 5/5Beds 3/5Staff 5/5Bathroom 2/5Brekfest 3/5

this hotel is very near with Hatagaya station. go outside from the station then turn right(choose the small street), go stright ... you will find the Ramen house(recommended! yummy and reasonable price about 550 yen) then go stright until you find mini market then turn right. The Sakura hatagaya is in the right side. We stay 2 adult & 2 kids, per night more/less 13,000 Yen(include breakfast).The breakfast very simple: bread + coffee/tea, open at 04.30 AM If you go outside Tokyo (we go to Hokaido-Sapporo), you can leave your baggage here...free... We leave our baggage in 1 week.Inside the Japanesse room, there small kitchen to cook. Scissor, frying pan, plate, knife are available.No heater here (we visit in winter), so its cold in the nightRecomended hotel!

Well located but not very near the main points, it was a bit hard to find, very clean and safe but with an awful mattress. They provide a nice breakfast enough to start the day. I would stay again if not for the mattress.

If you want a friendly staff services , this hotel is not for you, past commends are highly OVER RATED. That sort of price can go somewhere else better. The hotel required overall audit that's is this value fir money.

this is a good place for me . i’ come back again in soon. if you’re looking a little room for your trip, i suggest this hotel for you . absolutely love this place is easy and nearly the park for a little walk and relaxing atmosphere with you .

Hii... It's me Rienda. I was stayed at this hotel for 5 days on last November. I can say..i love this hotel! I definitely love this hotel. Eventhough the room was small, but it's ok. I like the simple breakfast they had. It's very near to the station which I can connect to the main stations at Tokyo.
